# Mud·dle

## Pronunciation

- <details><summary>ˈmədl</summary><audio controls><source src="https://ssl.gstatic.com/dictionary/static/sounds/20200429/muddle--_us_1.mp3"></audio></details>

## Meanings

### Verb

bring into a disordered or confusing state.

> "I fear he may have muddled the message"

confuse, mix up, jumble, disarrange, disorganize, disorder, disturb, scramble, mess up, jumbled, chaotic, topsy-turvy, disorganized, disordered, disorderly, out of place, out of order, mixed up, upside-down, at sixes and sevens, untidy, messy, scrambled, tangled, higgledy-piggledy, orderly

---

mix (a drink) or stir (an ingredient) into a drink.

> "muddle the kiwi slices with the sugar"

---

an untidy and disorganized state or collection.

> "the finances were in a muddle"
